resources.string: Hi, my name is My Fake Name. I remember the time when I saw Android for the first time on an online blog. It was Android 1.6. At that moment I said that this Operating System was going to be awesome and widely spread. Then I owned a traditional phone with a super small color screen, not a smartphone. It was a Sony Ericsson T610. It is awesome how much phones have been improved since then, becoming better and better. From about four year ago, I decided to become an Android developer. I had been programming in Python for the last two years before this, but when I had the opportunity to change to Android I did not doubt it. I had already been programming in Java for web and desktop apps, but Android was a completely different world for me. As the years went by, I started to realize that Java was not the perfect programming language for Android. It seemed a language which was not fit with a platform evolving so fast. Furthermore, I started to be tired of this language and the way it forced me to program. Everything became worse when I realized that Android was not going to support many modern features of the upcoming Java versions like Java 8 or 11. Suddenly, Google gave us good news. Kotlin was going to be the first language for Android. Kotlin and Jetpack libraries have given a boost to Android development. Both have given me back the enthusiasm to develop great apps for Android platform.
